heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 23 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 10 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 3.7°C), feels like temperature (up 4.4°C), outside temperature (up 3.7°C), and cloud levels (up 172 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 199.3m higher than yesterday, 153.0m higher than the past week, 172.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 791m to a maximum of 1764m, averaging 1245.2m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1092.2m and 1417.4m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; relatively cool weather. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and near calm conditions. Drizzle or light rain possible, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and periods of sunshine are expected. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (86%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
